alert.note: Alert for Coastal Kenedy; Coastal Willacy; Inland Kenedy; Inland Willacy; Northern Hidalgo (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 20 at 3:45PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Kenedy, northeastern Hidalgo, southeastern Brooks and northwestern Willacy Counties through 415 PM CDT... At 344 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles east of Rudolph to near San Manuel. Movement was southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Raymondville, Lasara, San Perlita, Norias, Reber Memorial Library, Raymondville High School, Rudolph, Raymondville Police Department, Yturria and San Perlita High School. This includes the following highways... Interstate Highway 69 E between mile markers 45 and 51. US Highway 77 between mile markers 742 and 762. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Kenedy; Coastal Willacy; Inland Kenedy; Inland Willacy; Northern Hidalgo
